title: Qualtrics
text: built functionality help access data directly Qualtrics. first step use functions register API key. get Oskar someone else OMNI team. also need Qualtrics base URL. omniinstitute.co1.qualtrics.com. Please check Oskar see changed. , can run following console register API key (change 1234567 actual API key, course) base URL R: credentials place, can now connect Qualtrics. Working R script file R Markdown document, run qualtrics_connect() function. read API key base URL registered previously ensure can connect Qualtrics successfully.

title: Qualtrics
text: can list surveys available Qualtrics account using qualtrics_list_surveys() function. return data frame information surveys account.

title: Qualtrics
text: access survey data, use qualtrics_get_survey() function. need provide survey ID, can get qualtrics_list_surveys() function. example, code might look like : return data frame data survey.

title: RMarkdown Template
text: installed package, access new custom RMarkdown template.

previous_headings: General OMNI Template > Creating a New Report
title: RMarkdown Template
text: can create new RMarkdown document uses OMNI template way ’d normally make new RMarkdown document: go File > New File > RMarkdown.

previous_headings: General OMNI Template > Creating a New Report
title: RMarkdown Template
text: Just load omni package using library(omni) type new_omni_report(). default, function creates new RMarkdown document called report.Rmd, can change anything want. can also enter argument function change way. example, type new_omni_report("snazzy-report") ’ll get RMarkdown file called snazzy-report.Rmd. ’ve created new project, look bottom right pane new RMarkdown document.

title: RMarkdown Template
text: knit report, RStudio create HTML PDF version report.

title: RMarkdown Template
text: create new RMarkdown document ’ll see bunch custom fields YAML. Please fill .  knit document, fields used populate first non-cover page report. bunch stuff YAML may look confusing . Please just leave everything works correctly!

title: RMarkdown Template
text: ’ll need make sure add titles figures, charts, tables. , use fig.cap chunk option. ’ll also need include special bit code help template know whether code chunk producing figure, chart, table (thus label number correctly). figure, example, ’d add .extra='data-prefix="Figure"' code chunk. substitute “Chart” “Table” appropriate code chunks. examples default content RMarkdown template.

title: RMarkdown Template
text: also simple report template cleaning analysis report template built package. can access using new_omni_report() function. ’ll need use type_of_report argument enter either “Simple Report” “Cleaning” get associated template.

title: Word Template
text: installed package, access new custom RMarkdown template. can create new RMarkdown document uses OMNI template way ’d normally make new RMarkdown document: go File > New File > RMarkdown > OMNI Word Template.

title: Word Template
text: ’ll need make sure add titles figures, charts, tables. , use fig.cap chunk option. ’ll also need include special bit code help template know whether code chunk producing figure, chart, table (thus label number correctly). figure, example, ’d add .extra='data-prefix="Figure"' code chunk. substitute “Chart” “Table” appropriate code chunks. examples default content RMarkdown template.

what: RMarkdown template, ggplot2 theme, and table function for OMNI Institute
title: RMarkdown template, ggplot2 theme, and table function for OMNI Institute
text: package contains RMarkdown template, color palettes, ggplot2 theme, function make tables OMNI Institute. template created OMNI Institute, Colorado-based nonprofit social science consultancy provides integrated research evaluation, capacity building, data utilization services accelerate positive social change. interested adapting OMNI branded template please contact omni@omni.org.

title: RMarkdown template, ggplot2 theme, and table function for OMNI Institute

what: Function to extract OMNI colors as hex codes — omni_colors
title: Function to extract OMNI colors as hex codes — omni_colors
text: omni_colors() enables pull colors directly OMNI palette. Choose one following options: Gray, Medium Gray, Dark Gray, Dark Blue, Medium Blue, Light Blue, Teal, Orange, Tan. use function follows: omni_colors("Dark Blue") returns hex value OMNI Dark Blue.

title: Function to extract OMNI colors as hex codes — omni_colors
code: omni_colors(   colors_sub = c("Dark Blue", "Medium Blue", "Light Blue", "Teal", "Orange", "Tan"),   variations_sub = "0",   named = FALSE )

title: Function to extract OMNI colors as hex codes — omni_colors
text: colors_sub color colors want return - vector variations_sub Variation, default 0 - vector named Snould output named ? FALSE default
